content.question: Which of the following expressions can be differentiated using the product rule?

choices.label: <math alttext="the arc sine of, open parenthesis, cosine x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>arcsin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="sine x times, open parenthesis, arc cosine x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arccos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="e to the x power, plus arc tangent x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 12 times x squared, plus 3 x, minus 6, close parenthesis, to the e power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>12</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="sine x times, open parenthesis, arc cosine x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arccos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
